thread.title: Former Liverpool striker tips Manchester United to pinch fourth place
thread.title_full: Former Liverpool striker tips Manchester United to pinch fourth place

title: Former Liverpool striker tips Manchester United to pinch fourth place
text:
Who impressed for Manchester United against Middlesbrough? Right now I’d still call United because of their ability to keep clean sheets Stan Collymore 
And that is because of United's defensive record (23 goals conceded in 27 league games), which is better than all of their rivals. 
"I’ve a feeling the top three as it stands are locked in now, too much attacking ability," Collymore told Boylesports . 
"Meaning we have the mother of all battles potentially between Liverpool, United, Arsenal and Everton (for fourth). GETTY Manchester United sit four points off Liverpool but have two games in hand GETTY Jose Mourinho's Manchester United side have conceded just 23 league goals all season GETTY Liverpool currently sit fourth in the table and drew 1-1 at Manchester City on Sunday 
"Right now I’d still call United because of their ability to keep clean sheets, which as we know in the final stretch is the most important thing when games get tight and nervous. 
"But what a helluva race in prospect. One thing is for sure, looks like one of Arsene, Jose, Klopp or Pep may miss out, showing whatever your CV, this league will test you to the hilt, and I love it." 
United face West Brom in their first game back after the international break, while Liverpool play Everton in the Merseyside derby. Related articles
